required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biological Monitoring of Nano Sized Particles in the Airways of Asthmatic Children
clinical_study.official_title: Biological Monitoring of Nano Sized Particles in the Airways of Asthmatic Children

brief_summary.textblock:
Background Ambient airborne particulate material (PM) is defined according the aerodynamic diameter into coarse, fine, and ultrafine or "nano" sized particles ranging between 2.5-10 µm (coarse), <2.5 µm (fine), and <0.1 µm (nano(. Many studies have examined particle effect on respiratory health in children, mainly by environmental monitoring of coarse and fine particles. Biological assessment of individual exposure to nano sized particles in correlation to adverse health effect was not previously studied.
Hypothesis individual exposure to nano sized particles in children is associated with reduction in forced expiratory volume at one second.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Ecologic or Community, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: forced expiratory volume at one second

secondary_outcome.measure: methacholine and adenosine challenge test results
secondary_outcome.description: provocative concentration causing a 20% fall in forced expiratory volume at one second and provocative dose causing a 20% fall in forced expiratory volume at one second

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age 6-18 years
- living in the Tel Aviv area
- referred to the pulmonology lab for respiratory function evaluation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Exposure to cigarette smoke
- Respiratory infection in the 4 weeks prior to recruitment and testing
